poem:
"Portrait of a Father's Love"

In the kitchen— 
nurturing, a father nurses
his rooted bond— 
not political spectacle
but love's spectacle. 

A disabled son, a gentle gaze,
repeated actions
in an unassuming narrative.

Not for seat counts,
nor for the undecided voter—
but for the world of a single child,
50 fold. 

A household dance  
of commitment and care,
showing his face to the dawn.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Liberal Democrats election broadcast shows Ed Davey with disabled son The Liberal Democrats have used their first election broadcast of the campaign to show Ed Davey in a highly personal light, part of a focused and targeted approach that the party hopes could win them close to 50 seats. The broadcast includes footage of Davey at home as he looks after his teenage son, John, who is disabled, in part to highlight the work of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
